intro: Ervatamia subglobosa, commonly known as the globular ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense arrangement of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental appeal, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and hardy nature.
